item.title: CRI015 Dan Kaminsky
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with security expert and hacker Dan Kaminsky
item.description: An interview with security expert and hacker Dan Kaminsky
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI015
Veröffentlicht am: 06.01.2008, 01:30 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 29.12.2007 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri015.html
Dan Kaminsky An interview with security expert and hacker Dan Kaminsky
Dan Kaminsky is an experience security researcher and excellent presenter. In this recording, Tim Pritlove talks with Dan about his work, security in general, international security and community events, differences between the American and European hacker communities, voting computers, freedom and privacy, the relationship of hackers to the media, how Microsoft invited the international security hacker scene and what programming teams should do to make sure the security is done right from the start.
Links:
* 24C3 http://events.ccc.de/congress/2007/ * Dan Kaminsky http://www.doxpara.com/ * Delphi http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delphi_online_service * c-base http://www.c-base.org/ * Hack In The Box http://hitb.org/ * ToorCon http://www.toorcon.org/ * ShmooCon http://www.shmoocon.org/ * DEF CON http://defcon.org/ * Microsoft http://www.microsoft.com/ * WP: Fuzzing http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuzzing * WP: Tiger Team http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiger_Team

xhtml:body.p: Dan Kaminsky is an experience security researcher and excellent presenter. In this recording, Tim Pritlove talks with Dan about his work, security in general, international security and community events, differences between the American and European hacker communities, voting computers, freedom and privacy, the relationship of hackers to the media, how Microsoft invited the international security hacker scene and what programming teams should do to make sure the security is done right from the start.

item.title: CRI014 Bre Pettis
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Bre Pettis who is making things and builds hacker spaces
item.description: An interview with Bre Pettis who is making things and builds hacker spaces
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI014
Veröffentlicht am: 19.12.2007, 09:08 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 17.12.2007 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri014.html
Bre Pettis An interview with Bre Pettis who is making things and builds hacker spaces
Bre Pettis is a "maker" and a video podcaster for Make Magazine. In this podcast, Tim Pritlove and Bre Pettis discuss hacker spaces, CCC events, being an all-in-one video producer, teacher and passionate maker. The discussion touches other interesting topics like the being a teacher in the US, brain machines, volcanoes in Seattle, earthquakes, do-it-yourself survival, Club-Mate and other lifesaving issues.

In this podcast, Tim Pritlove and Bre Pettis discuss hacker spaces, CCC events, being an all-in-one video producer, teacher and passionate maker. The discussion touches other interesting topics like the being a teacher in the US, brain machines, volcanoes in Seattle, earthquakes, do-it-yourself survival, Club-Mate and other lifesaving issues.

item.title: CRI013 FSFE Freedom Task Force
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Shane Coughlan
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI013
Veröffentlicht am: 17.02.2007, 00:00 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 13.01.2007 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri013.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Shane Coughlan
FSFE Freedom Task Force An interview with Shane Coughlan
Tim Pritlove talks to Shane Coughlan of Free Software Foundation Europe who is in charge of the FSF Freedom Task Force (FTF) project. The FTF provides actively supports free software projects by providing consulting and networking support as well as a new service called Fiduciary Licence Agreement (FLA) that allows copyright holders of free software to pass over the exploitation rights to the FSF or other project foundations. By handing over these rights, GPL violations can be much easier taken care of as it is no longer the obligation of the individual copyright holder to go after these violations. In the interview, Shane Coughlan explains how this works and which projects should consider making use of the FLA.
Links:
* Shane Coughlan http://www.fsfe.org/fellows/shane * Free Software Foundation Europe (FSFE) http://fsfeurope.org/ * eWar: Cyber Warfare http://www.shaneland.co.uk/ewar/ * Fellowship of FSFE http://www.fsfe.org/en * GNU General Public License (GPL) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_General_Public_License * FSFE Freedom Task Force http://fsfeurope.org/projects/ftf/ftf.en.html * Enigmail http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enigmail * Software license http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_license * Free software license http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_software_license * Sun Microsystems http://www.sun.com/ * Netfilter/iptables http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Netfilter/iptables * German Copyright Law (Urheberrecht) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_copyright_law * Copyright http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright * Fiduciary Licence Agreement (FLA) http://www.fsfeurope.org/projects/fla/fla.en.html * GNU Compiler Collection (gcc) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_Compiler_Collection * GPL Violations Project http://www.gpl-violations.org/ * GPL Compliance Checklist http://www.fsf-europe.org/projects/ftf/faq-compliance.en.html

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove talks to Shane Coughlan of Free Software Foundation Europe who is in charge of the FSF Freedom Task Force (FTF) project. The FTF provides actively supports free software projects by providing consulting and networking support as well as a new service called Fiduciary Licence Agreement (FLA) that allows copyright holders of free software to pass over the exploitation rights to the FSF or other project foundations. By handing over these rights, GPL violations can be much easier taken care of as it is no longer the obligation of the individual copyright holder to go after these violations. In the interview, Shane Coughlan explains how this works and which projects should consider making use of the FLA.

item.title: CRI012 Interview with Pablos
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview about hands-on hacking and the american hacker scene
item.description: An interview about hands-on hacking and the american hacker scene
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI012
Veröffentlicht am: 27.01.2007, 10:30 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 22.01.2007 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri012.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Pablos
Interview with Pablos An interview about hands-on hacking and the american hacker scene
Tim Pritlove talks to Pablos (aka Paul Holman), a gifted hacker from Seattle, USA. In the interview he talks about the the importance of hands-on hacking and reverse engineering as well He also gives some background on the case of Dmitry Sklyarov who got arrested under the Digital Millenium Copyright Act in 200x
Pablos also talks about some of the projects that he is pursuing in his Hackerbot laboratories, the american hacker scene, the Shmoo group and the ShmooCon hacker conference as well his observations of the European hacker scene.
Links:
* DLD 07 Conference http://www.dld-conference.com/ * Pablos at DLD07 http://www.dld-conference.com/2006/12/paul_pablos_holman.html * Rapid prototyping http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_prototyping * OQO http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OQO * Shmoo group http://www.shmoo.com/ * Defcon http://defcon.org/ * Toorcon http://www.toorcon.org/ * ShmooCon http://www.shmoocon.org/ * Ben Laurie http://www.apache-ssl.org/ben.html * Reverse Engineering http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reverse_engineering * Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act * Dmitry Sklyarov http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmitry_Sklyarov * Hackerbot http://www.hackerbot.com/ * 2600 Meetings http://www.2600.com/meetings/

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove talks to Pablos (aka Paul Holman), a gifted hacker from Seattle, USA. In the interview he talks about the the importance of hands-on hacking and reverse engineering as well He also gives some background on the case of Dmitry Sklyarov who got arrested under the Digital Millenium Copyright Act in 200x

Pablos also talks about some of the projects that he is pursuing in his Hackerbot laboratories, the american hacker scene, the Shmoo group and the ShmooCon hacker conference as well his observations of the European hacker scene.

item.title: CRI011 Interview with Steven Levy
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview about the history and significance of the hacker movement
item.description: An interview about the history and significance of the hacker movement
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI011
Veröffentlicht am: 26.01.2007, 02:00 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 22.01.2007 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri011.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Steven Levy
Interview with Steven Levy An interview about the history and significance of the hacker movement
Tim Pritlove talks to Steven Levy, author of the book "Hackers - Heroes of the Computer Revolution" that for the first time reported on the hacker movement beginning in the late 1960ies and led to the definition of the Hacker Ethic which Levy summarized out of observation of the hacker scene.
In the interview, Steven Levy explains how he come to know this particular scene, how he gained the trust of the hackers and what his findings were. He also talks about the hacker scene not covered in the book: the hackers of the 1990ies, the free software movement and the overall achievements of the hackers over time.
Links:
* Steven Levy http://www.stevenlevy.com/ * "Hackers - Heroes of the Computer Revolution" http://www.stevenlevy.com/index.php/other-books/hackers * Tech Model Railroad Club (TMRC) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tech_Model_Railroad_Club * Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Massachusetts_Institute_of_Technology * "Crypto" http://www.stevenlevy.com/index.php/other-books/crypto * Homebrew Computer Club http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homebrew_Computer_Club * Altair 8800 Computer http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Altair_8800 * "Artificial Life" http://www.stevenlevy.com/index.php/other-books/artificial-life * Richard Stallman http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Stallman * Free Software Foundation http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_Software_Foundation * Lisp Machines http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lisp_Machines * MIT Artificial Intelligence Lab http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MIT_Artificial_Intelligence_Laboratory * Lee Felsenstein http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lee_Felsenstein * Steve Wozniak http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Wozniak * Andy Hertzfeld http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Hertzfeld * Napster http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Napster * Peer-to-peer http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer * Hacker Ethic http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hacker_ethic * CCC comments on the Hacker Ethic http://www.ccc.de/hackerethics * Spacewar! http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spacewar%21 * Bob Dylan http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bob_Dylan * Hackerbibel http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hackerbibel * Die Datenschleuder http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Die_Datenschleuder * Chaos Communication Congress http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chaos_Communication_Congress * George Orwell http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Orwell

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove talks to Steven Levy, author of the book "Hackers - Heroes of the Computer Revolution" that for the first time reported on the hacker movement beginning in the late 1960ies and led to the definition of the Hacker Ethic which Levy summarized out of observation of the hacker scene.

In the interview, Steven Levy explains how he come to know this particular scene, how he gained the trust of the hackers and what his findings were. He also talks about the hacker scene not covered in the book: the hackers of the 1990ies, the free software movement and the overall achievements of the hackers over time.

li.a: CCC comments on the Hacker Ethic

item.title: CRI010 mama net.culture club
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Tomislav Medak of Multimedia Institute in Zagreb, Croatia
item.description: An interview with Tomislav Medak of Multimedia Institute in Zagreb, Croatia
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI010
Veröffentlicht am: 15.06.2006, 23:00 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 15.06.2006, 17:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri010.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Tomislav Medak
mama net.culture club An interview with Tomislav Medak of Multimedia Institute in Zagreb, Croatia
Tim Pritlove talks to Tomislav Medak who is president of the Multimedia Institute, which is a independent group of activists in Croatia. Multimedia Institute runs an open space called mama net.culture club in the center of Zagreb. Tomislav explains the history and background of the project, current activities and general aims of the group.
The second part of the interview goes into more detail about the current exhibition called System.hack() of Multimedia Insitute which explains the term hacking by picking six "hacks" of the last 70 years that demonstrate the roots and nature of hacking.
Links:
* Tomislav Medak http://tom.mi2.hr/ * Multimedia Institute / mama net.culture club http://www.mi2.hr/ * EGOBOO.bits netlabel http://www.egoboobits.net/ * zvukbroda http://www.egoboobits.net/ZvukBroda * zvukbroda: TRI (MP3) http://egoboobits.net/ZvukBroda_tTRI/09-ZvukBroda__tTRI.mp3 * "FREEDOM TO CREATIVITY!" Wells http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/H.G._Wells * The War Of The Worlds http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_%28novel%29 * Orson Welles' adaption of War Of The Worlds http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_War_of_the_Worlds_%28radio%29 * Orson Welles http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orson_Welles * John Draper http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Draper * Cap'n Crunch http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cap%27n_Crunch * Phreaking http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phreaking * GNU General Public License http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GNU_General_Public_License * Heath Bunting http://www.irational.org/cgi-bin/cv/cv.pl?member=heath * Superweed 1.0 - Natural Reality http://www.irational.org/cta/superweed/ * * Michael Steil http://www.michael-steil.de/ * XBOX Linux Project http://www.xbox-linux.org/ * 19C3: Its my box: how the hardware and software traps in the Xbox were beaten and Linux installed http://www.ccc.de/congress/2002/fahrplan/event/399.de.html * 20C3: Xbox Hardware Hacking http://www.ccc.de/congress/2003/fahrplan/event/604.de.html * 22C3: "Xbox" and "Xbox 360" Hacking http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/events/559.en.html * System.hack() Reader http://www.systemhack.org/BooK

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove talks to Tomislav Medak who is president of the Multimedia Institute, which is a independent group of activists in Croatia. Multimedia Institute runs an open space called mama net.culture club in the center of Zagreb. Tomislav explains the history and background of the project, current activities and general aims of the group.

The second part of the interview goes into more detail about the current exhibition called System.hack() of Multimedia Insitute which explains the term hacking by picking six "hacks" of the last 70 years that demonstrate the roots and nature of hacking.

li.a: "FREEDOM TO CREATIVITY!" Free Culture, Science and Technology Festival
Orson Welles' adaption of War Of The Worlds
19C3: Its my box: how the hardware and software traps in the Xbox were beaten and Linux installed

item.title: CRI009 The Pirate Bay
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with Peter of the famous BitTorrent tracker site
item.description: An interview with Peter of the famous BitTorrent tracker site
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI009
Veröffentlicht am: 02.06.2006, 21:00 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 02.06.2006, 12:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri009.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Peter
The Pirate Bay An interview with Peter of the famous BitTorrent tracker site
Tim Pritlove talks to Peter who is one of the maintainers and system administrators of The Pirate Bay system which has become the biggest BitTorrent tracker system in the world effectively generating half of Swedens Internet traffic. The system was recently raided by Swedish police after the US government complained about the site to the swedish government. This interview was done two days after this incident happened and while the Pirate Bay System was still offline.
Peter explains what exactly happened during the police raid and explains the history and philosophy behind the anti-copyright scene in Sweden and the technical details of the Pirate Bay system and the BitTorrent protocol in particular. He also explains what the technical difficulities are in maintaining the service and the amount private data the system stores and handles.
Links:
* reboot conference Copenhagen http://reboot.dk/ * The Pirate Bay Web Site http://thepiratebay.org/ * Wikipedia: The Pirate Bay http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Pirate_Bay * BitTorrent protocol http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BitTorrent * Peer-to-peer http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peer-to-peer * Wikipedia: Piratbyrån http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piratbyr%C3%A5n * Piratbyrån http://www.piratbyran.org/ * Svenska antipiratbyrån (Swedish Anti-Piracy Bureau) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Svenska_antipiratbyr%C3%A5n * Antipiratbyrån Web Site http://www.antipiratbyran.com/ * Piratpartiet (Pirate Party) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pirate_Party * ABBA http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABBA * Britney Spears http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Britney_Spears * Backstreet Boys http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backstreet_Boys * Ingmar Bergman http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ingmar_Bergman * 22C3: Rasmus Fleischer http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/speakers/471.en.html * 22C3: The grey commons http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/events/1101.en.html * Sweden general election, 2006 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sweden_general_election%2C_2006 * Hash value http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_function * Suprnova.org http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suprnova.org * PRQ Web Hosting http://prq.se/ * MPAA Press Release "SWEDISH AUTHORITIES SINK PIRATE BAY" (PDF) http://mpaa.org/press_releases/2006_05_31.pdf * Guantanamo Bay Naval Base http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guantanamo_Bay_Naval_Base
Music:
* Seth Gekko - Close Up http://www.minimalmusik.net/gekko/?p=22 * Seth Gekko http://www.seth-gekko.de/

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove talks to Peter who is one of the maintainers and system administrators of The Pirate Bay system which has become the biggest BitTorrent tracker system in the world effectively generating half of Swedens Internet traffic. The system was recently raided by Swedish police after the US government complained about the site to the swedish government. This interview was done two days after this incident happened and while the Pirate Bay System was still offline.

Peter explains what exactly happened during the police raid and explains the history and philosophy behind the anti-copyright scene in Sweden and the technical details of the Pirate Bay system and the BitTorrent protocol in particular. He also explains what the technical difficulities are in maintaining the service and the amount private data the system stores and handles.

li.a: MPAA Press Release "SWEDISH AUTHORITIES SINK PIRATE BAY" (PDF)

item.title: CRI008 Interview with Whitfield Diffie
item.itunes:subtitle: A look back at 30 years of public key cryptography
item.description: A look back at 30 years of public key cryptography
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI008
Veröffentlicht am: 01.06.2006, 02:00 Uhr Aufnahme vom: 25.05.2006, 22:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri008.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Whitfield Diffie
Interview with Whitfield Diffie A look back at 30 years of public key cryptography
Tim Pritlove interviews Whitfield Diffie, one of the fathers of public-key cryptography 30 years after his and his colleagues' revolutionary discovery of the so-called Diffie-Hellman key exchange method that deeply revolutionized the field of computing and computer security. Whitfield explains the discovery of the algorithm, his relationships to copyright and patent law, the birth of the public-key cryptography community. Whitfield proceeds to discuss current challenges in the area of network security, trust management and privacy problems. He goes forward to explain his view on the history and meaning of the word "hack". He also explains what kind of encryption he uses for personal communication, how encryption should be handled and what the future has in store for cryptographic research.
Links:
* Whitfield Diffie http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitfield_Diffie * Ralph Merkle http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_Merkle * New Directions in Cryptography http://citeseer.ist.psu.edu/340126.html * Diffie-Hellman key exchange http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diffie-Hellman_key_exchange * Key management http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_management * Martin Hellman http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Hellman * Public-key cryptography http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography * RSA http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA * Ron Rivest http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ron_Rivest * Adi Shamir http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adi_Shamir * Leonard Adleman http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leonard_Adleman * ElGamal encryption http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ElGamal_encryption * National Security Agency (NSA) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Agency * Donald Knuth http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Donald_Knuth * Albert Einstein http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Einstein * Patent http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patent * Copyright http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright * James Ellis http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_H._Ellis * Supply-side economics (voodoo economics) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supply-side_economics * Clifford Cocks http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clifford_Cocks * Knapsack problem http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knapsack_problem * Stanford AI lab http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stanford_AI_lab * John McCarthy http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_McCarthy_%28computer_scientist%29 * Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard * Hash function http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hash_function * Elliptic curve http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_curve * MQV http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MQV * Data Encryption Standard (DES) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard * Sun Microsystems http://www.sun.com/ * Web service http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_service * Java http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_%28Sun%29 * Gordon Bell http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gordon_Bell * Network File System http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Network_File_System * ONC Remote Procedure Calls (Sun RPC) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ONC_RPC * Pixar http://www.pixar.com/ * MPEG-4 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPEG-4 * Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DCMA) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act * Edsger Dijkstra http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edsger_Dijkstra * Tech Model Railroad Club (TMRC) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tech_Model_Railroad_Club * Jargon File: Hack http://www.catb.org/jargon/html/H/hack.html * Pretty Good Privacy (PGP) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_Good_Privacy * SSL (Secure Socket Layer) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security * GSM A5/1 stream cipher http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A5/1 * Web of trust http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_of_trust * Oblivious transfer http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oblivious_transfer * Simultaneous contract signing http://citeseer.ist.psu.edu/723829.html * Quantum computer http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_computer
Music:
* Adaptive - Insidedope [swm009] http://www.sonicwalker.com/2006/05/19/adaptive-insidedope-swm009/ * Sonic Walker http://www.sonicwalker.com/

xhtml:body.p: Tim Pritlove interviews Whitfield Diffie, one of the fathers of public-key cryptography 30 years after his and his colleagues' revolutionary discovery of the so-called Diffie-Hellman key exchange method that deeply revolutionized the field of computing and computer security. Whitfield explains the discovery of the algorithm, his relationships to copyright and patent law, the birth of the public-key cryptography community. Whitfield proceeds to discuss current challenges in the area of network security, trust management and privacy problems. He goes forward to explain his view on the history and meaning of the word "hack". He also explains what kind of encryption he uses for personal communication, how encryption should be handled and what the future has in store for cryptographic research.

item.title: CRI004 Interview with Jacob Appelbaum
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.description: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI004
Veröffentlicht am: 30.12.2005, 20:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri004.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Jacob Appelbaum
Interview with Jacob Appelbaum Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
Chaosradio International Nr. 4 is yet another interview with a speaker at 22C3: Jacob Appelbaum. In a very intense and personal way, Jacob reports on his experiences visiting Kurdistan (Iraq) and the post-Katrina times in Houston and New Orleans this year.
Links:
* Jacob Appelbaum's weblog http://jacob.wordpress.com/ * It's complicated (Jacob Appelbaum's Live Journal) http://www.livejournal.com/~ioerror/ * Oregon Trail http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Oregon_Trail_%28computer_game%29 * 22C3: A discussion about modern disk encryption systems http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/events/1112.de.html * OpenBSD http://www.openbsd.org/ * NetBSD http://www.netbsd.org/ * Diyarbakır http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diyarbakır * Zakho http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zakho * United States Department of Defense (DOD) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Defense * Arbil http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arbil * Kirkuk http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kirkuk * Jacob's photographs on flickr http://flickr.com/photos/ioerror/ * Hurricane Katrina http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Katrina * Reliant Astrodome http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reliant_Astrodome * Jacob's photoset "Hurricane Katrina victims in Houston" http://flickr.com/photos/ioerror/sets/905698/ * Prometheus Radio Project http://www.prometheusradio.org/ * Boing Boing http://boingboing.net/ * EVDO Overnite Wireless Internet Service http://evdo-coverage.com/ * Gizmodo http://gizmodo.com/ * Guerilla News Network http://gnn.tv/ * Algiers, Louisiana http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algiers%2C_Louisiana * Crooks and Liars http://www.crooksandliars.com/ * Jacob's photoset "New Orleans post Katrina" http://flickr.com/photos/ioerror/sets/1005205/ * Disaster Mortuary Operational Response Team (DMORT) http://dmort.org/ * 'This is criminal': Malik Rahim reports from New Orleans http://www.socialistresistance.net/MalikRahim.htm * Common Ground Collective Algiers http://www.commongroundrelief.org/ * Hurricane Rita http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hurricane_Rita * Webzine 2005 http://www.webzine2005.com/ * DEFCON http://defcon.org/ * The Fifth HOPE http://www.the-fifth-hope.org/hoop/ * Next 5 Minutes: International Festival of Tactical Media, Amsterdam http://www.next5minutes.org/
Musik:
* Cotumo - Unfoundsound Labelmix (Zerinnerung Mix 021) http://www.zerinnerung.de/mix.php?id=21 * Zerinnerung DJ-Mix Netlabel http://www.zerinnerung.de/

xhtml:body.p: Chaosradio International Nr. 4 is yet another interview with a speaker at 22C3: Jacob Appelbaum. In a very intense and personal way, Jacob reports on his experiences visiting Kurdistan (Iraq) and the post-Katrina times in Houston and New Orleans this year.

item.title: CRI003 Interview with Eric Blossom
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.description: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI003
Veröffentlicht am: 29.12.2005, 20:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri003.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Eric Blossom
Interview with Eric Blossom Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
Chaosradio International episode 3 is an interview with with Eric Blossom, old-school hacker and founder and project manager of the GNU Radio project. In the interview, Tim and Eric talk about Burning Man, his lecture on passive radar at 22C3, reactions at the conference, the role of hackers and hacking in general and other topics.
Links:
* Eric Blossom - Blossom Research, LLC http://comsec.com/ * Reno, Navada http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reno%2C_Nevada * Burning Man http://burningman.com/ * PDP-11 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PDP-11 * Fortran http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortran * GNU Radio http://www.gnu.org/software/gnuradio/ * 22C3: I can see airplanes http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/events/543.de.html * Passive Radar http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Passive_radar

* Oliver Günsel - Sonata (Zerinnerung Mix 020) http://www.zerinnerung.de/mix.php?id=20 * Zerinnerung DJ-Mix Netlabel http://www.zerinnerung.de/

xhtml:body.p: Chaosradio International episode 3 is an interview with with Eric Blossom, old-school hacker and founder and project manager of the GNU Radio project. In the interview, Tim and Eric talk about Burning Man, his lecture on passive radar at 22C3, reactions at the conference, the role of hackers and hacking in general and other topics.

item.title: CRI002 Interview with Joi Ito
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.description: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI002
Veröffentlicht am: 29.12.2005, 15:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri002.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Joi Ito
Interview with Joi Ito Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
Chaosradio International episode 2 is an interview with 22C3's keynote speaker Joi Ito http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joi_Ito . The interview touches various topics including Chicago's club scene and Joi's affiliation with it, the early Internet days via X.25, Creative Commons licensing issues, the Open Source Initiative, political activism in general and what can and should be done, optimism vs. pessimism in the current situation of global political fighting, ICANN, living a super-public life and combining all kinds of modern communication tools, the influence of the Internet on political activism and democracy and of course the 22C3 http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/ and his personal experiences at the event.
This interview is the same as in Chaosradio Express 011 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cre011.html but includes an english introduction.
Links:
* Joi Ito's Web http://joi.ito.com/ * Joi Ito on 22C3 http://joi.ito.com/archives/2005/12/27/22c3_talk.html * Joi Ito's Socialtext Workspace http://joiwiki.ito.com/joiwiki/index.cgi * Laibach http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Laibach_%28band%29 * Apple II http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apple_II * Bulletin Board System http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bulletin_board_system * X.25 http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.25 * ARPANET http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARPANET * Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Point-to-Point_Protocol * Serial Line Internet Protocol http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Serial_Line_Internet_Protocol * Creative Commons http://creativecommons.org/ * Open Source Initiative http://www.opensource.org/ * Software patents http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_patent * Software Patents vs Parliamentary Democracy http://swpat.ffii.org/ * Firefox http://www.mozilla.com/firefox/ * ICANN http://icann.org/ * International Telecommunication Union http://www.itu.int/ * Otaku http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Otaku * ICANN Meetings http://www.icann.org/meetings/ * Orkut http://www.orkut.com * Friendster http://www.friendster.com/ * Pseudonym http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudonym * The Mine Ban Treaty http://www.icbl.org/treaty * Lawrence Lessig http://www.lessig.org/blog/ * Technorati http://www.technorati.com/ * Six Apart http://www.sixapart.com/ * Emergent Democracy http://joi.ito.com/static/emergentdemocracy.html
Music:
* Q-Man - Speed Merchant (Zerinnerung Mix 005) http://www.zerinnerung.de/mix.php?&id=5 * Zerinnerung DJ-Mix Netlabel http://www.zerinnerung.de/

xhtml:body.p: Chaosradio International episode 2 is an interview with 22C3's keynote speaker Joi Ito. The interview touches various topics including Chicago's club scene and Joi's affiliation with it, the early Internet days via X.25, Creative Commons licensing issues, the Open Source Initiative, political activism in general and what can and should be done, optimism vs. pessimism in the current situation of global political fighting, ICANN, living a super-public life and combining all kinds of modern communication tools, the influence of the Internet on political activism and democracy and of course the 22C3 and his personal experiences at the event.
This interview is the same as in Chaosradio Express 011 but includes an english introduction.

item.title: CRI001 Interview with Régine Débatty
item.itunes:subtitle: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.description: Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
item.itunes:summary:
Chaosradio International CRI001
Veröffentlicht am: 29.12.2005, 07:00 Uhr http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cri001.html
Teilnehmer: Tim Pritlove (Moderation), Régine Débatty
Interview with Régine Débatty Live from the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress
Chaosradio International Nr. 1 is the first of a few planned interviews with speakers of the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress. Régine Débatty is well-known for her work on her weblog " We Make Money Not Art http://www.we-make-money-not-art.com/ " that focuses on Media Art and provides a wealth of information every day. The talk revolves on how to make a living of running a weblog, the current state of media art, the originality of ideas, the influence of artists on society and a couple of projects that deal with RFID and video surveillance.
This interview is the same as in Chaosradio Express 010 http://chaosradio.ccc.de/cre010.html but includes an english introduction.
Links:
* We Make Money Not Art http://www.we-make-money-not-art.com/ * 22C3: Technological art off the trodden tracks http://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/fahrplan/events/1085.de.html * Paul Graham: Hackers and Painters http://www.paulgraham.com/hp.html * Hackers - Heroes of the computer revolution (The Hacker Ethic) http://www.echonyc.com/~steven/hackers.html * Art & Beauty @ 22C3 https://events.ccc.de/congress/2005/wiki/Art_%26_Beauty * Project Blinkenlights http://www.blinkenlights.de/ * Troia http://www.bbm.de/troia/troia.html
Music:
* [in]anace - Interest Complex (Zerinnerung Mix 002) http://www.zerinnerung.de/mix.php?&id=2 * Zerinnerung DJ-Mix Netlabel http://www.zerinnerung.de/

xhtml:body.p: Chaosradio International Nr. 1 is the first of a few planned interviews with speakers of the 22nd Chaos Communication Congress. Régine Débatty is well-known for her work on her weblog "We Make Money Not Art" that focuses on Media Art and provides a wealth of information every day. The talk revolves on how to make a living of running a weblog, the current state of media art, the originality of ideas, the influence of artists on society and a couple of projects that deal with RFID and video surveillance.
This interview is the same as in Chaosradio Express 010 but includes an english introduction.

li.a: 22C3: Technological art off the trodden tracks
Hackers - Heroes of the computer revolution (The Hacker Ethic)
